summary: Auto-Saving based on the passage of time.  You can set the time between saves anywhere from 60-600 seconds.
descriptionHtml:
Name: Configurable Auto-Saver


------------------------------------------------------
Author: MojoDaJojo

------------------------------------------------------

0: Name / Author
1: Thanks / Credits
2: Requirements
3: Description
4: Related or Recommended Files and/or Files of Interest
5: Installation / Uninstallation
6: Version History / Bug Fixes
7: Incompatibilities / Known Issues
8: Legal

------------------------------------------------------
1: Thanks/Credits

Bethesda - For making games that someone as challenged as me can mod.

The Nexus - For the most troll free & hassle free place to upload a mod.


------------------------------------------------------
2: Requirements

A legal copy of Skyrim.

------------------------------------------------------
3: Description

Saves are made with Game.RequestSave()

It will give you the message \"AutoSaving\", 

but the saves should be unique like full saves.

Configure in-game with the lesser power, CAS Lesser Power. 

Saves are disabled by default.  You can set the time between saves anywhere from

60-600 seconds.


------------------------------------------------------
4: Related or Recommended Files and/or Files of Interest

Kuertee\'s Auto-Save and Time
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/13239

------------------------------------------------------
5: Installation / Uninstallation

Install:

Dump the files from the mod into your Skyrim/Data folder.


Uninstall:

Disable the auto saving before uninstalling then:

Remove the files that came with the mod.
An easy way to do this would be to copy, (not cut),
the files into the folder a second time, and overwrite everything.
Now hit undo.
Assuming you\'re using windows this will delete the necessary files.


------------------------------------------------------
6: Version History / Bug Fixes

.8 

1. One of the floats in this briefly uploaded version tended to skyrocket which would make it not save for 20-30 minutes... oops

_____

.81 

1. Fixed the sky-rocketing float. Tested it the rest of the day. Seems to work correctly now.

_____

.82 

1. Repackaged for compatibility with NMM.

2. Updated readme and file header

------------------------------------------------------
7: Incompatibilities / Known Issues

1. Skyrim saved games don\'t forget scripts. 

   So make sure to disable everything before uninstalling. 

2. I would not use this at the same time as the vanilla saves, or with any other auto-saving mod.

3. Kill scenes (and probably some other things I don\'t know about) can interrupt a save, 

   but it won\'t stop the script.  However, the timer will be reset so a 1 minute save setting will take 2 minutes 

   if a kill scene happens at the wrong time.


------------------------------------------------------
8: Legal


Do not upload this to any site other than the Nexus. (Without consulting me first.)
Otherwise, I don\'t care what is done with any of the parts of this, 
but you must follow the rules set by Bethesda and/or The Nexus.
author: MojoDaJojo

1. Packaged for NMM compatibility
2. Updated readme and file header
